pr_title: [RW-4254][RISK=NO] Wording changes to Select All communication

timeline.message: Change text for Select All/UnSelect concepts

timeline.bodyText: opt nit: pull out these state variables into locals as well?
timeline.author: calbach

timeline.bodyText: I'm confused by this. At this point in the code is there some kind of guarantee that the user has selected everything being displayed on the page? If selectAll is false, why do we assume they have selected ROWS_TO_DISPLAY concepts.
timeline.author: calbach

replies.bodyText: the method updateSelectedConceptList(selectedConcepts, origin) sets the state variable showBanner to be true only if the user selects the checkbox in the header
replies.author: NehaBroad

replies.bodyText:
I think showBanner should be renamed to something like allVisibleConceptsSelected. Also, I can't reconcile the logic at L204 with what you're saying here.
Say I do the following - doesn't this work incorrectly?

Click select all checkbox
-> banner says "selected 20 concepts"
deselect one concept
-> banner still says "selected 20 concepts"?
replies.author: calbach

timeline.bodyText: The word "all" here does not seem like it should be included in the case where they haven't selected everything.
timeline.author: calbach

replies.bodyText: I missed the text, its supposed to be You’ve selected all 20 concepts on this page.
replies.author: NehaBroad

timeline.message: remove banner if user deselects concepts
